channel.title: Life on A minimal Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in Life on A minimal Hugo website

item.title: arcos and arcospy now in JOSS!
item.description: Just a short post to announce a milestone in the arcos and arcospy journey! A writeup of the software was accepted at The Journal of Open Source Software. The paper is available online here. This was quite the adventure, and I thought it would be fun to quickly lay out the major moments leading up to this point. Summer 2019: I read a Washington Post story about the release of a large portion of the ARCOS database and an accompanying software package to access the data called arcos.

item.title: PhD Year 2 Semester 1 Plans
item.description: The end of summer came crashing in and I find myself starting the second year of the PhD program in Geographical Sciences at the University of Maryland, College Park. For the Fall semester I will be focusing on research and teaching. With Dr. Stewart’s guidance I have been able to make substantial progress on the first paper of the dissertation, and I hope to circulate the paper among co-authors in the coming weeks.

item.title: GSOC Blog #11: A conclusion to GSOC!
item.description: A conclusion to Google Summer of Code 2020 A huge thank you to to @sjsrey, @ljwolf, @darribas, @slumnitz, @TaylorOshan, and the larger PySAL group for acting as mentors throughout the summer and welcoming me to the PySAL community. This was a wonderful exercise in developing open-source software and I would highly recommend future students consider contributing to PySAL! After a summer condensed into ten blog posts we arrive at the finale - one final blog post to mark the end of the program.

item.title: GSOC Blog #10: Progress on Local Geary
item.description: A few brief life updates In a moment typically reserved for ‘As seen on TV ads…’, I knocked over an entire glass of water onto my laptop a few days ago. While the laptop sports one of the new Ryzen 7 8-thread CPUs, the technology remains quite sensitive to water. A nearly-full 8 ounce glass of water came tumbling down on the keyboard. Like most times of brief crisis, I was stunned at what was happening before me.

item.title: GSOC Blog #5: The final week of Phase 1!
item.description: Introduction We are rapidly heading towards the final week for the first phase of GSoC 2020! What a wild ride it has been - I can’t believe it’s only been around a month and a half! Brief blog post this week as there is lots to do. Phase 1 Progress Recap I’ve produced solid draft of all of the functions original identified in the proposal, with inference working for nearly all of them.

item.title: PhD Year 1 Semester 2 Recap and Summer Plans
item.description: Going to keep this update brief as I will be doing a lot more blogging this summer (more on that later)! This semester was incredibly challenging. Probably the hardest semester of work and school I have ever countered. Yet as things in life tend to do, everything came together at the finish line. Class projects, research expectations, and personal goals. I completed the first stage in the doctoral process at UMD - the Comprehensive Portfolio.

item.title: PhD Year 1 Semester 1 Recap
item.description: What a wild ride this semester has been! It’s 2:03AM on 1/3/2020. Considering what has happened in the past two hours, everything I’ve done seems a bit trivial. But we press on. I’m most proud of arcospy, a python translation of an existing R package. More info here. The TLDR is that I built a python API that allows users to query the Drug Enforcement Agency (DEA) ARCOS opioid dataset for 2006-2012.
